docs.lead_paragraph: We had a grief conversation, yesterday evening, with Major SANDERSON. who arrived night before last on the Clara from Fort Leavenworth, en route from Fort Laramie. The Major, it will be recollected, left Jefferson Barracks in June last, under orders for the South Pass of the Rock Mountains, on account of some reports of Indian hostilities in that region.

headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church and Missionary Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The work of founding a new Church of the Presbyterian denomination at Manhattanville, has attracted the attention of the City Churches- A Board of Trustees has been organized, and ground is already purchased for the establishment of the Church. The edifice will be erected on the corner of One Hundred and Twenty-Fifth-street, and Ninth-avenue. Solicitations are put forth for further did.

headline.main: TRIAL OF BISHOP DOANE.; Proceedings of the Court of Bishops.

docs.lead_paragraph: We stated generally on Saturday morning the proceedings of the Episcopal Court, so far as they had proceeded and could be ascertained, in the case of Bishop DOANE. The first important question, as heretofore published, was on the motion for the removal of the Court to Burlington.

headline.main: Expedition in Search of Sir John Franklin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following letter from Capt. MAGUIRE at the Sandwich Islands, on his way to join the Plover, to the command of which vessel he is appointed to succeed Capt. MooRE, is of interest, as showing what he proposes to effect, and the need he feels of further assistance.

headline.main: The Most Rev. Archbishop of Santa Fe de Bogola in New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Petrel, from Saint Thomas, brought to this port on Friday last an illustrious Confessor of the Faith, in the person of his Grace DON MANUEL JOSEPH MOSQUERA, Archbishop of Santa Fe de Bogota in New Granada Archbishop MOSQUERA is a member of one of the most illustrious families of Spanish America, and the descendant of one of the historical houses of old Spain. headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; GENERAL SCOTT AT THE WEST. From Cincinnati to Dayton.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Burnet House, at Cincinnati, was one continued scene of excitement all the morning-visitors crowding in shoals to see General SCOTT. A large number of Irish citizens, in all some three hundred, came in to pay their respects; they assured the General that, having heard he was not well, they would not have called, except to testify their respect, and show that they disbelieved the slanders spread abroad concerning him.

byline.original: By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: Hon. A. Dixon--Naturalization in Ohio--Julian and Cassius M. Clay on the Stamp in Kentucky--The Weather, &c., at Cincinnati.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health of Hon. A. DIXON is improving. Eight hundred and fifty foreigners have been natural iced in Hamilton, Ohio, since the 6th of September. Hon. GEORGE W. JULIAN is speaking in Kentucky, with CASSIUS M. CLAY. They denounce both the Whig and Democratic candidates and platforms, because of their support of the Fugitive Slave Law.
docs.abstract: Stumps Kentucky in favor of Free Soil
